author: Oil_Interesting
body: I own Teradyne. Was not aware of Keysight. Going to do more research. any other companies you like or dislike? always enjoy perspective from engineers. I own TSM QCOM AVGO TXN SWKS MRVL QRVO ASML.

author: BumbleFuckDuck
body:
Realistic target price is meaningless if you're holding long, to which I am. ZOM has a lot of room for upward mobility before March and afterwards. The Karen's will screech "$1 compliaaaance" which anyone that keeps up with pennies know a stock has to clear $0.20 to be compliant, not $1. 

The value in ZOM's BAW technology will have an impact in the veterinary world. QORVO isn't a shit company, they must likely see value in this company if they decided to partner with a penny stock. Patience will reward you.

Edit: I know for shit that this stock will excel past $1 in 2021.

author: CharizardEmpire
body:
Seeking Advice: I have invested into a couple stocks/ETFs precovid, now which ones deserve more of my deposits moving forward?

Thank you in advanced to any folks that gives this a read. 

23, earning 70k yearly, saving for long term, open to risk, no debt

For some background info, I have invested 20K diversified into a mutual fund(VFIAX), 7 ETFs(VDE, VNQI, VGT, VB, CIBR, NOBL,USO) and 15 Stocks around March/April 2020 time period(AAPL, ETSY, MSFT,QRVO,QCOM,SWKS,SNE,TMUS,etc: Plan to sell NOK, ATVI and ERIC). I have not invested much since as I am trying to build my savings again however I aim to start investing $400 - $500 per month into my brokerage account starting 2021. Now my issue is how do I allocate that money into my stocks and funds? I have high priced stocks like Tesla(641) and Twilio(309). While also having lower priced stocks like Cloudflare(81) and Pagerduty(40). Now which stocks and ETFs deserve deposits of new money? The ones that are winning or the ones that are losing? Or should I plan to reinvest into 1 to 2 companies per month? So that by the time a year completes every stock/etf has had their fair share of deposits.

If any additional information is needed, please let me know! Thanks again

author: PAHoosier
body:
QRVO - up 60% on it since May

RPRX - bought during IPO a few months back - it's starting to come back to IPO price but i love the long term outlook. They invest into Royalties of pre-approved medicines. if they hit on a few it will generate a lot of revenue.

SPG - great dividend - got beat down by Covid but will bounce back

SDC - been holding onto this one for a bit but over time i think it will continue to grow

SFIX - wish i didn't sell at 25 :(

author: BumbleFuckDuck
body: I believe ZOM is still good to jump in in the .20's range. My average is $0.15 and been holding since August. I told myself I would buy in more if it dipped below .20, still haven't dipped below .20 lol. I'm content with my position and confident ZOM will continue its steady climb as we get closer to Truforma's release date. Their BAW technology that is co-developed with QRVO shows the different applications it can be used for besides veterinary usage. ZOM in my autistic belief is a lowkey golden nut

author: im-buster
body: Wow, somebody actually posted some stocks are aren't all over reddit.  I like QRVO, but TI and IIVI are my semi stocks. I just bought SPG recently.  People are ready to shop. I'm not familiar with the others. I'll have to check them out.

author: WhatnotSoforth
body:
People fighting each other to get into the rocket ship bruh! 🚀

Lots of attention has been paid to this little scrappy underdog if you knew to look for it, but it’s been popping up in a lot of mainstream sites as a hot buy opportunity. And it is!

Commercialization of their bread and butter Truforma machine will be coming in a few months and people are digging in now. 

I’m siting on 2.3k. My plan is getting some profit on at least 3 lots early this week and perhaps buying in again next week if it dips some. FOMO is likely to be heavy since it’s so cheap, both now and in a couple months. 

Qorvo is the big daddy company that makes the acoustic modules for Truforma, so it’s also in play for trading if you’re up for it.
